127141010.baseEffect_:
Fanfare: Add 1 to the number of cards played this turn.
Can evolve for 0 evolution points.
127141010.baseFlair_: When the Verdant Ring was founded, our ancestors bid me to grow it further, that I may "better slaughter our enemies." To be treated liked a beast was a fate I couldn't permit for my son... And so I filled the tree with my Crimson Incense, blotting out all life within.
127141010.evoEffect_: Evolve: If X is at least 4, give +2/+2 and Storm to all allied Condemned followers. X equals the number of turns you played at least 4 cards this match.
127141010.evoFlair_: I'll do whatever it takes to ensure my son succeeds me as leader. Denizens of this steel forest, fight with me, or flee—it does not matter. But if you choose battle, prepare to scatter and fall, for all that awaits us is the aromatic sleep of death.

127141030.baseEffect_:
Drain.
Fanfare: Give your leader the following effect - Once on each of your turns after you become able to evolve, when an allied Fairy comes into play, give it Storm. (This effect is not stackable and lasts for the rest of the match.)
Fanfare: If at least 10 allied Forestcraft followers have left play this match, evolve this follower.
127141030.baseFlair_: Huh? Who are you? Oh, wait, your weary face just gave it away! Yep, you're just like me—looking for a nap spot in the forest, aren't you?! Come on, let's find the perfect place to take a nap together!
127141030.evoEffect_: (Same as the unevolved form, excluding Fanfare.)
127141030.evoFlair_: Feels great to have perfect weather like this, huh? You know, life's not so bad all the time. After I take a nap, I always feel chipper and raring to go! Here—a blessing to guarantee sound sleep! Just a little present from your "partner in naptime," hehe.

719141010.baseEffect_:
Drain.

Fanfare: If at least 10 allied Forestcraft followers have left play this match, evolve this follower.

719141010.evoFlair_:
Beautiful songs straight from your heart!
—Hatsune Miku

129141010.baseEffect_:

-Fanfare: Evolve this follower.
-At the end of your turn, return this card to your hand.
129141010.baseFlair_:
The dark forces writhe, hungering for the world's end. Chosen hero, I've been waiting for you. Unite with the other chosen, and save this world...
—Aria, A Hero's Tale, Pt. 2
129141010.evoEffect_:
Storm.
Strike: If allied followers have evolved at least 7 times this match, give Storm to all allied Fairies.
129141010.evoFlair_:
How could this be?! You gave your life protecting us... Now it's our turn to give back and restore your life. We need you—the world and me both.
—Aria, A Hero's Tale, Pt. 2

100114010.baseEffect_:
Deal 2 damage to an enemy follower.
Put a Fairy into your hand.
100114010.baseFlair_: One leaf, one wound. One branch, one bone.

705114010.baseEffect_:
Deal 2 damage to an enemy follower.
Put a Fairy into your hand.
705114010.baseFlair_: I won't pardon anyone who aims to bring harm to our village! Prepare yourself!

713114010.baseEffect_:
Deal 2 damage to an enemy follower.
Put a Fairy into your hand.
713114010.baseFlair_:
I may just be an ordinary girl... but that doesn't mean I can't fight! I'll prove it to you—Sylvan Justice!
—Mimori Amamiya

101114040.baseFlair_: The lord of the forest is quite generous. He won't go so far as to take your life.

102114050.baseFlair_: If you ever get lost in the forest, open your eyes and just look. You're sure to see the gentle little forest dwellers glittering in the shade.

116114010.baseEffect_: Give an allied follower +1/+1, Rush, and Follower Strike: Deal X damage to the enemy follower. X equals this follower's attack.

If at least 2 other cards were played this turn, deal 2 damage and draw 2 cards instead.
123114010.baseFlair_:
With a pop-pop-pop, we plant our seeds! One more time, say pop-pop-pop! If scary folks invade our wood, then pop-pop-pop, we'll plant 'em in the ground! And pop-pop-pop, a new tree is born!
—Forest Elves' Lullaby

715114010.baseEffect_:
Deal 1 damage to a random enemy follower. Draw a card.
If at least 2 other cards were played this turn, deal 2 damage and draw 2 cards instead.

124114010.baseEffect_:

Add 1 to the number of cards played this turn.
Deal 4 damage to a random enemy follower.
124114010.baseFlair_:
Shiranui's Longbow: 6,600 rupies
Matzelblad, Enchanted Bow: 7,400 rupies
Bow (Elven-carved): 230,000 rupies
—Weapon Shop Signboard

127114010.baseEffect_:
Return an allied follower or amulet to your hand.
Deal 3 damage to a random enemy follower and then 2 damage to the enemy leader.
127114010.baseFlair_: Men who are not of the forest pride themselves on swift spearmanship that sweeps past the wind itself. In the forest, to earn renown as a lancer, one must learn to work in tandem with the wind.

106124010.baseEffect_:
Put 2 Fairies into your hand.
Give all allied followers +1/+1 if at least 2 other cards were played this turn.
106124010.baseFlair_: Music is better for capturing fairies than either bait or traps. And it's best to play it as lively and merrily as possible. After all, fairies love tunes that make them want to dance. —Forest instrumentalist

111124010.baseEffect_: Deal 5 damage to a random enemy follower with the lowest attack in play.
111124010.baseFlair_: If a weakling like you managed to survive this long, the world outside these woods must be a paradise.

708124010.baseEffect_: Deal 5 damage to a random enemy follower with the lowest attack in play.
708124010.baseFlair_:
No matter how skilled the warrior, they can't defeat war itself. He's that kind of Heroic Spirit.
—Shirou Emiya

117124010.baseFlair_:
Aha! These tree roots are making the entire forest sick!
—Lila, Arborist

713124020.baseEffect_:
Restore 3 defense to an ally.
If at least 2 other cards were played this turn, recover 1 evolution point.
713124020.baseFlair_:
Selfish woman.
—Lelouch
Of course. I am C.C., after all.
—C.C.

Summon a Fairy. If at least 2 other cards were played this turn, summon 2 instead.
Give all allied Fairies Clash: Deal 1 damage to the enemy follower.
118124010.baseFlair_: The forest is a battleground. The creatures that dwell within fight root and branch, weeding each other out so that only the strong may bloom beautifully under the sun. Do not enter lightly, lest you be caught in the crossfire.

121124010.baseFlair_:

"Sweet. I'll lend you a hand—or a big old paw. Lol."

"L-Ladica?!"
—Tales from Naterra, Side Story

128124010.baseFlair_: The willow's branches hang across the forest clearing like the bars of a gate. Any who pass to the other side find themselves permanent residents of the woods—if they get that far.

129124010.baseEffect_:

If you've played at least 2 other cards this turn, randomly put 1 of the highest-cost Forestcraft followers from your deck into your hand.
129124010.baseFlair_:
Who knew so many people would come from every corner of Rivenbrandt? I'll have to grace the party venue with as much of the forest's blessing as I can! Sigh... The chosen one sure is popular...
—Liza, A Hero's Tale, Pt. 8

105134010.baseEffect_: Deal X damage to 2 random enemy followers. X equals the number of other Neutral cards in your hand.
105134010.baseFlair_:
"Can you dodge our arrows?"
"Let's try and see!"

112134010.baseEffect_: Deal X damage to all followers (excluding Fairies and Fairy Wisps). X equals the number of other cards played this turn.
112134010.baseFlair_: This wind is the pulse of the forest; this gust is the will of the woods. Trespasser, behold the marvels of nature.

116134010.baseEffect_:
Choose: Use play points equal to this card's cost and play this card as an Arisa's Leadership or Ladica's Embrace.
If at least 2 other cards were played this turn, instead summon 2 Fairies and deal 3 damage to a random enemy follower.
116134010.baseFlair_:
Resolve guides them as they bound toward a harrowing fate. Headstrong they stand, even as the requiem begins to play.
"I won't give up on hope! Not while there's still breath in my body!"

118134010.baseEffect_:
Give an allied Forestcraft follower the ability to evolve for 0 evolution points.

Then, if at least 4 times, give the selected follower +2/+2.
Then, if at least 6 times, give it Storm.
118134010.baseFlair_: The verdant vitality of the forest fills the fairies with good cheer. It isn't long before their cheer careens over into mayhem.

120134010.baseEffect_:
Deal 3 damage to an enemy follower.
If at least 4 other cards were played this turn, give +2/+1 to all allied followers.
120134010.baseFlair_: The first strike sows the seeds of flame. The second waters the soil. The third jolts the buds. Whether they bloom in the end is up to the forest.

715134010.baseEffect_:
Deal 3 damage to an enemy follower.
If at least 4 other cards were played this turn, give +2/+1 to all allied followers.
715134010.baseFlair_:
Heh, I bet you didn't know this azure blade can change elements. Surge forth, crimson flames!
—Rin Shibuya

900134010.baseEffect_:
Deal 2 damage to an enemy follower.
Restore 2 defense to your leader.
900134010.baseFlair_: Meow-wee! Excellent! The more prey, the merrier! —Shamu

900134020.baseEffect_: Give an enemy follower -X/-0 until the end of the opponent's turn. X equals the number of other cards in your hand.
900134020.baseFlair_: Meow-wow! I've found us a tasty looking treat to play with! —Shama

900134030.baseEffect_: Deal 3 damage to an enemy follower. If at least 2 other cards were played this turn, restore 3 defense to your leader.
900134030.baseFlair_: I love this land. I can't just abandon it.

Your opponent draws a card.

900144100.baseFlair_: I'm stronger because of all the trials I've faced up until now. I won't run away—not while there's a future where we can all laugh together. Get ready, because I'm not holding back!

101113010.baseEffect_:
Countdown (2)
At the end of your turn, select a random enemy follower. It can't attack next turn.
101113010.baseFlair_: Hear the whispering trees. Feel the warm sunbeams. Let them lull you into a gentle sleep.

108113010.baseEffect_:
Countdown (2)
Fanfare: Draw a card.
Whenever this card is returned to your hand, put a Fairy Wisp into your hand.
Last Words: Put a Fairy Wisp into your hand.
108113010.baseFlair_: Beautiful petals fluttering. Mischievous giggles sounding. This woodland jewel is the forest dwellers' home.

110113010.baseEffect_:
Countdown (1)
Fanfare: Select an enemy follower. It can't attack next turn.
Enhance (4): Add 2 to this amulet's Countdown.
At the end of your turn, put a random Forestcraft follower from your deck into your hand.
110113010.baseFlair_: You're being watched. Not by me, of course. It's the forest that's keeping tabs on you. — Elf's Warning

101122010.baseEffect_: At the end of your turn, draw a card if at least 3 cards have been played this turn.
101122010.baseFlair_: Let us give thanks for this bountiful harvest.

105123010.baseEffect_:
Countdown (2)
Fanfare: Put 2 Fairies into your hand.
While this amulet is in play, all allied followers in play and that come into play have Clash: Deal 1 damage to the enemy follower.
105123010.baseFlair_: Eek! You're scaring me! Don't come any closer, okay? —Bramble Fairy

120123010.baseEffect_:
Fusion: Fairies
----------
Countdown (3)
At the end of your turn, activate 1 of the following effects in order. If this amulet is fused with at least 1 card, activate 2 effects instead.
1. Draw a card.
2. Summon a Fairy and give it Ward.
3. Restore 2 defense to your leader.
120123010.baseFlair_:
"Hey, what do you think this tree is here for?"
"I dunno—it's a tree. Leave the philosophical stuff for the humans. That's what they do best."
—Fairies

100111060.baseEffect_: Strike: Put a Fairy into your hand.
100111060.baseFlair_: Tsk, don't you ever get tired of chasing after me? I told you I was leaving. Leave me be—I slipped out of that circle.
100111060.evoFlair_: I just can't sit around and wait for the day I finally die. That's why I left the forest behind and took up the sword. No more lying safe in my cradle. I walk my own path now.

101111050.baseEffect_: Whenever another allied follower comes into play, deal 1 damage to a random enemy follower.
101111050.baseFlair_: We forest dwellers all stick together. Don't think you can mess with me 'cause I'm alone!
101111050.evoFlair_: Hee-hee! See? If everyone from the forest lends a hand, we can take down enemies you'd have no hope against alone!

101111060.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Select an enemy follower. It can't attack next turn.
101111060.baseFlair_: You seem tired, stranger. Would you care for some water? Hee-hee! Oh, there's no need to thank me...
101111060.evoFlair_: What? You can't move? Oh! Didn't I tell you that I'm the spirit of a poisoned fen? Hee-hee! I do love watching humans struggle.

102111030.baseEffect_: Whenever another allied follower comes into play, restore 1 defense to your leader.
102111030.baseFlair_: Oh no! Snap out of it! I'll give you the help you need, so hold on just a little more.
102111030.evoFlair_: Here, let me sprinkle this spring water on you. Soon your wounds will heal!

103111040.baseEffect_: Last Words: Put a Woodkin Curse into your hand.
103111040.baseFlair_: A symbol of fortune to friends of the forest and a walking curse for its foes.
103111040.evoFlair_: A woodland spirit that carries out the will of the forest. If you seek to harm the forest, prepare to bear its curse.

104111030.baseEffect_: At the end of your turn, give all other allied followers +0/+1.
104111030.baseFlair_: O children of the earth! The earth is my flesh, and my love will support you as long as you stand on your own two feet.
104111030.evoFlair_: O children of the earth! The earth is my flesh, and I shall walk with you until you return to me.

104111040.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Gain +1/+1 and Storm if at least 2 other cards were played this turn.
104111040.baseFlair_: They fire splinters of great trees that pierce steel armor like it's nothing from atop beetles that can outspeed even dragons. In other words, they're our natural enemies. —Veteran Dragoon
104111040.evoFlair_: Infantry is beaten by cavalry, which is in turn beaten by dragoons. We're the ultimate force on the battlefield. But you'd do well not to assume that this logic holds once Mother Nature comes into play. —Veteran Dragoon

105111030.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Gain +1/+1 and Ward if there are at least 3 other Neutral cards in your hand.
105111030.baseFlair_: Normally the statement the forest lives is intended as metaphor, but on rare occasions it's literally true. —The Living Forest, Author's Preface
105111030.evoFlair_: The forest that was there yesterday had vanished overnight. Gazing at the tracks on the ground, I muttered to myself, "The forest lives." —The Living Forest, Chapter 1

106111020.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Put a random amulet from your deck into your hand.
106111020.baseFlair_: Look up and all you'll see are leaves and branches. You can't see a single star in the forest! So I've made up my mind to leave the forest and see the night sky!
106111020.evoFlair_: Sure, being in the forest is safe, but it's no fun! No matter where you walk, all you see is green. So that's why I think there's a bright future waiting for me outside somewhere!

107111010.baseEffect_: Whenever this follower's attack or defense is increased by an effect, deal 1 damage to a random enemy follower.
107111010.baseFlair_: I can't be entrusted to protect this forest if I keep relying on everyone else's help. Just you wait, because I'm gonna be great one day!
107111010.evoFlair_: This forest has always protected and watched over me, so I gotta do my best too! My hand is steady—here goes! In the name of the forest, I'll shoot this arrow!

108111030.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Put a random follower with X attack from your deck into your hand. X equals the number of cards played this turn, including this card.
108111030.baseFlair_: Here it is, the concert we've all been waiting for! Let's make all our practice count! Now, we'll begin this first passage adagio.
108111030.evoFlair_: It's time to crescendo! Let the music flow through you, and soon the audience will be jumping for joy! A-one, two, three!

109111030.baseFlair_: They roam the land upright on two legs, breeding and increasing in numbers at their destination. They're renowned for their sublime flavor, but one should be careful not to consume too much.
109111030.evoFlair_: After hunting these mushroom creatures, seek help if your skin feels irritable. Their spores can spread to your lungs, and before long you'll begin feeling like a mushroom yourself.

111111020.baseEffect_:
Rush.
Fanfare: Enhance (6) - Gain +3/+3.
Strike: Put a Fairy into your hand.
111111020.baseFlair_: Iiiit's showtime! Hey, I know how I look, but the forest is my lovely baby! You mess with the woods, you get felled! Understand?
111111020.evoEffect_: (Same as the unevolved form, excluding Fanfare.)
111111020.evoFlair_: Iiiit's showtime! I may seem kinda rowdy, but don't judge me by my looks! I'm everybody's lovely baby! I'll trash anyone who troubles the trees! Understand?

112111020.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Put a random Machina card from your deck into your hand.
112111020.baseFlair_: Outsiders continue throwing their broken machines into the forest, the place I call home. I will gladly take it upon myself to collect their trash, for you see, here in the forest we help each other out.
112111020.evoFlair_: Now, where to put the parts I've collected? Should I just attach them to the junk I found yesterday? If anyone finds out how much I enjoy fiddling with these metallic creations, it'll be the end of me. Sigh... And yet my heart's always aflutter when I'm tinkering around.

113111030.baseEffect_: Fanfare: If another Machina card was played this turn, gain Storm.
113111030.baseFlair_: Core mutations have led to one new discovery after another. Robotic bagworms use technology for defensive purposes, while this elf uses it as a means to attack. —Veteran Researcher's Report, Vol. 1
113111030.evoFlair_: Your cocoon's impressively novel, but novelty isn't everything. Fruit's tastiest, after all, just before it goes soft. —Mechaclaw Elf to Robotic Bagworm

115111030.baseEffect_:
Storm.
Fanfare: Enhance (6) - Summon a Mallet Monkey.
Enhance (9): Summon 1 more.
115111030.baseFlair_: Ooh-ooh-ah! Ooh-ooh, ah-ah! Ooh-aaah! (This thing's light as a feather! Bet I can use it to knock down loads of fruit from the treetops!)
115111030.evoEffect_: (Same as the unevolved form, excluding Fanfare.)
115111030.evoFlair_:
"Wow! So strong!"
—Water Fairy
"Are you telling me that hammer isn't hollow?"
—Fairy

118111010.baseEffect_:
Fanfare: Put a Fairy into your hand.
Enhance (6): Put 2 into your hand instead. Gain +2/+2. Recover 2 play points.
118111010.baseFlair_: Eek! Who knew they'd make their move on my watch?! So that's where the squirrels have been stashing their acorns!
118111010.evoFlair_: Whoa! I didn't think this would happen during my night patrol! The fairies are spinning the squirrels' acorns like tops! Kinda mean, don't you think?

120111010.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Choose - Put an Entangling Vines or Ivy Spellbomb into your hand. Add 1 to the number of cards played this turn.
120111010.baseFlair_: The forest is governed by its own set of rules. Unruly ivy, you shall not grow here. If you encroach upon the flowers, then by the forest's decree, I will be forced to prune you.
120111010.evoFlair_: The forest is unforgiving, sometimes plucking the life of those who walk beneath its canopies. Foul ivy, I will rip you from the earth and use you as traps, for even those punished by the wood are given new purpose—that is the law of the forest keeper.

120111040.baseEffect_:
Fanfare: Put a Fairy Wisp into your hand.
Whenever an allied Fairy Wisp or Fairy comes into play, restore 1 defense to your leader.
120111040.baseFlair_:
The fairy swung a stick and sent an acorn flying my way. If I caught it, she cheered; if I dropped it, she jeered. It was a strange experience... Was she playing some sort of fairy trick on me?
—A Perplexed Traveler
120111040.evoEffect_:
Evolve: Summon 2 Fairies.
Whenever an allied Fairy Wisp or Fairy comes into play, restore 1 defense to your leader.
120111040.evoFlair_:
"Wow, I didn't think you could keep up with all those hits! You're good!" —Fairy Slugger
"Nom, nom. Another excellent acorn. Her swings aren't bad, either." "We ought to sign her before another team gets to her." —Fairy Teammates

121111020.baseEffect_: Fanfare and Last Words: Put a Naterran Great Tree into your hand.
121111020.baseFlair_: The metallic ivy that popped up turned out to be a blessin', eh? There's definitely enough to keep you and the others going; I'll pass the word on to Mánagarmr to keep an eye out too. Even if the ivy's not going anywhere, it can't hurt to know where it grows.
121111020.evoEffect_: (Same as the unevolved form, excluding Fanfare.)
121111020.evoFlair_: What did you say you used to track prey? A con-pew-tur? Thanks to your help, there'll be plenty to eat! C'mon, everyone! Let's make this a right proper feast!

123111030.baseEffect_: Last Words: Put a Nature's Guidance into your hand.
123111030.baseFlair_: A tiny woodland creature with a sparkling horn. Its numbers have dwindled due to the predations of careless hunters, who often mistake its horn for the carbuncle's.
123111030.evoFlair_: The weak were culled, leaving only the stronger beasties. Don't let their adorable looks fool you—the hunted are now the hunters.

124111010.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Transform an enemy follower into a Fairy.
124111010.baseFlair_:
I'll forever rue the day I decided to visit this damned forest. Two days and still no sign of an exit—Wait! That light... H-hey! Wait for me!
—Ancient Bamboo Inn, I
124111010.evoFlair_:
Not all souls are fortunate enough to stumble upon our humble inn. Feel free to drop in for a day, or spend the night here if you wish.
—Fairylight Guide

124111030.baseEffect_:
Storm.
Fanfare: If at least 2 other cards were played this turn, gain +2/+2.
124111030.baseFlair_:
"I saw true speed in the brambles above."
—Message carved into a tree
124111030.evoEffect_: (Same as the unevolved form, excluding Fanfare.)
124111030.evoFlair_: In the face of great gusts that fell trees, vines remain firm and flexible, bobbing and weaving like windswept leaves. I'd better jot this down... "I saw true resilience in the brambles above."

125111030.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Summon a Hornet Warrior. If at least 2 other cards were played this turn, summon 2 instead.
125111030.baseFlair_: Did you just call me "difficult"? Whatever. I don't expect you to understand. My friends from out of town get me... They also have a low tolerance for big oafs who buzz around shouting out pointless orders.
125111030.evoFlair_: Y-you actually get me? It's so rare to find someone on the same wavelength... Wanna meet my friends? We usually hang out in the forest; it's such a relief not having to put up with mindless drones.

127111030.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Draw 2 cards. If at least 2 other cards were played this turn, evolve this follower.
127111030.baseFlair_: Forests, villages—blah, blah, blah. Useless distinctions, really! From up above, everything is connected! How about it, partner? You up for a quick flight over the woods and towns? There's big money to be made!
127111030.evoFlair_:
"Welcome—oh, if it isn't my airborne business rival."
"Well, I'm sure as heck not going to walk everywhere! Flying's faster—keeps the produce fresh! Anyway, I'll have one bag. Don't worry, I'll keep to my terrority."
—A Chat with the Forest Merchant

129111020.baseEffect_:
Storm.
Fanfare: Enhance (5) - Gain +2/+2. Deal 4 damage to an enemy follower.
129111020.baseFlair_: Pro tip: To survive in the wild, camouflage your carnivorous intentions in the calm of the forest. Once you've sighted your prey, never let them escape. And if they fight back, never give them an opportunity to turn the situation around.
129111020.evoEffect_: (Same as the unevolved form, excluding Fanfare.)
129111020.evoFlair_: Pro tip: If you're hunting, make your kill in the forest. Seize any chance to go for the jugular. Once you've got them by the tail, never let go until you've achieved your objective.

101121010.baseEffect_: Fanfare and Last Words: Put a Fairy into your hand.
101121010.baseFlair_: I love these grand dances. A fairy just never knows who she may meet! Tee-hee, I wonder who'll dance with me tonight.
101121010.evoEffect_: (Same as the unevolved form, excluding Fanfare.)
101121010.evoFlair_: Just look at it all—the merrymaking, the laughter, the joy! Tonight let's dance until dawn comes!

101121030.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Gain +1/+1 for each other card played this turn.
101121030.baseFlair_: You'd be wise to leave quickly, trespasser. This forest belongs to the fairies. Should you fail to heed my words, I'll be forced to remove you.
101121030.evoFlair_: So many years ago, I wandered into this forest under the charms of the fairies and was captured. Of course I wanted to go home at first. But now I know in my heart that I must protect this forest. Witness the power the fairy king has bestowed on me!

101121040.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Destroy an enemy amulet if at least 2 other cards were played this turn.
101121040.baseFlair_: A magical flower which grows deep within the forest. Once it blossoms, it consumes all life around it, stripping the area bare to fuel its own growth.
101121040.evoFlair_: It is not only the fruits of the land that are consumed by this carnivorous plant. Humans and other creatures caught within its vines are all gobbled up without mercy.

107121010.baseFlair_: Wait, that's not it! I just have to nock the arrow here and... Oh, come on! How do I do this? I'm not ready yet! Just... give me a moment so I can shoot you, okay?
107121010.evoEffect_: Evolve: Deal 2 damage to X random enemy followers (up to 5 followers). X equals the number of cards played this turn, including this card.
107121010.evoFlair_: I did it! I finally hit the mark! Now you'll get a taste of my skill! Wait, I'm out of arrows? What am I supposed to do now?

108121020.baseFlair_: Owl Man: he is... the forest's heart.
108121020.evoFlair_: Owl Man: he is... the forest's conscience.

113121020.baseEffect_:
Rush.
Whenever an allied Fairy comes into play, destroy it.
Whenever an allied Fairy is destroyed, gain +1/+1 and deal 1 damage to the enemy leader.
113121020.baseFlair_: Long ago there was a sickly boy who fell in love with a fairy. The fairy granted him protection, but a pestilence spread throughout his land as a result. The boy's eyes came to burn with hatred and rage for her.
113121020.evoFlair_: You insist you never intended to destroy the land? It was an unfortunate coincidence? What a terrible joke! Even if that's the truth—it's too late now. I despise you. What else are you good for than this?

115121020.baseEffect_:
Rush.

As this cycle of growth continues, the land of blessing becomes a forest. But the oathbearer is no longer alone. She is joined by a multitude of mighty warriors.
—Teachings of the Great Forest, Part 7

Wilt, wither, decay,

Ambush.

125121020.evoFlair_:
He is the marvel of the forest.
He is the hope of the forest.
He is... Brightplume Owl Man.

105131010.evoFlair_: Once I charge up my magic, any foe will be gone in one blow! But after that, my energy and magic are through.

109131010.evoFlair_: "Meow-wee! I just love a good chase!" "Meow-wow! Come now, we'll play with you until you can't even stand!"

112131020.baseEffect_: When you play a spell, evolve this follower.
112131020.baseFlair_: You know, honestly, all I want out of life is attention! That's why I got into this whole mountaineering thing. What? Why mountains? Duh—they're like the new "it" thing! She who climbs the tallest peaks finds the tallest man!
112131020.evoFlair_: Oh. My. God. That girl is soooo gorgeous! She's just, like, radiating beauty. I hate her. Like, so much that I could just foam at the mouth... Grr...

114131010.baseFlair_: Agriwrestling is a sacred battle dance celebrating the harvest. I doubt I could have performed it before—I was such a weakling. But thanks to my teachers, I'm not that person anymore! Here I go! Lightning Plowshares!

120131010.evoFlair_: This world is such an haute mess. Clearly it's up to me to make it haute couture! Let's see, how about some florals to start? There, you look much less tragic already! Once I'm through with you, you'll be burning that trash heap you call clothes! Ngwah-ha-ha-ha-ha!

121131010.baseEffect_:
Fanfare: Put a Fairy into your hand.
Whenever you play a card that originally costs 1 play point or less, draw a card.

121131010.evoEffect_: (Same as the unevolved form, excluding Fanfare.)
121131010.evoFlair_: Like a dried leaf, the intruder falls to the ground. The sage blinks, shaking off memories. He recalls feeling helpless rage as his home burnt, as his wings were torn. "How bold of you to think that your life is worth more than an insect’s." —Feyfolk Sage

Rush.

124131010.baseFlair_:
Glub... glub... The surface of the water faded into obscurity as the man sunk into the depths below. "There shall be no drowning here—not on my watch."
The young man, once wrought with despair, was returned to the surface. "Blessings of the spring upon you, child."

717131010.baseFlair_:
Glub... glub... As the man's conscience faded, a voice rippled through the spring. "It'd be a real waste to drown on a such lovely afternoon."
He woke on the banks, cleansed of his woes. "Well? C'mon, the water's nice and refreshing!"
717131010.evoEffect_:
Ward.
Evolve: Give your leader the following effect - At the start of your turn, add 1 to the number of cards played this turn. (This effect is not stackable and lasts for the rest of the match.)

A warm light bathed the spring as the two smiled. "Enough of that—let's play! I won't lose the splash fight this time, you hear?!"

Much like a great tree's branches, the pinnacle of fairy swordsmanship is ever rising skyward. He hones his techniques now with as much diligence as ever.

116141030.baseFlair_: Glittering. Ephemeral, fragile, and strong. That is the nature of the forest's lifeblood, the resplendence that I command! Now, I beseech that same eternal vitality—lend power to my sword!
116141030.evoEffect_:
Ward.
Evolve: Deal 1 damage to a random enemy follower. Do this X times. X equals the number of cards in your hand.
116141030.evoFlair_: The misery of the trees, the anger of the flowers, everything is a demand of the Queen. And why I must press forth with the forest at my back! O enemies of the weald, you will know the woodborne wrath of my blade!

107111020.evoFlair_: Where do we come from, and where are we going? Without knowing, I'll go on. Without knowing, I'll live on. The forest is unexpectedly pleasant... Perhaps I'll make a new life here.

Ward.

108111010.evoFlair_: You kids will never learn unless a grown-up teaches you a thing or two. Guess I'll just have to show you what happens when elves get angry.

110111010.evoFlair_: The god stood on two legs... a being that could well have created man in its image. It was the revelation of a lifetime. Its hulking figure as it reared up to protect its territory was indeed divine... —Researcher's Notes

Ward.

113111010.evoEffect_: (Same as the unevolved form, excluding Fanfare.)
113111010.evoFlair_: Without courage, you couldn't do a thing! A sharp sword and a sturdy shield would just gather dust. The greatest weapon of all is courage!

117111010.evoFlair_: While he is often lost in thought, he would never lose his way in the woods. From underbrush to canopy, the forest is his refuge. He is an elusive philosopher, evading confrontation whenever he can.

Ward.

Rush.

"What's the plan, girlies?"

"Then we lure 'em into the swamp!"
—Fairy Pathfinder and Her Fairy Friends

Ward.

100121030.baseFlair_: Beg your pardon—I was told not to let anyone pass through this rose garden. Would you be so kind as to leave? I'd prefer not to use force.

100121030.evoFlair_: My warnings go unheeded then. A shame. Would that I could show you mercy. Do not struggle against the thorns now. Foolish and ugly you may be, but at least you'll serve to fertilize the garden.

102121010.baseFlair_: Driven to free her captured ally, Yuel commanded will-o'-wisps to banish the darkness. No foe could escape her fiery wrath.

109121010.baseFlair_: My sister's a prodigy, the kind that only appears once a century. I'm nothing compared to her, so surely she is more worthy of the sacred bow.

110121020.evoFlair_:
The Second Law: Observation
Complete or incomplete, everything is equal in existence. There is no room for intervention, no space for devotion.
—Teachings of the Unkilling Guardian

112121010.evoFlair_: The critters in the forest are becoming increasingly frantic. Intruders enter our home accompanied by strange machines, while others wield curious bows—bows that even we elves couldn't hope to wield. —Forest Rumors, Part 2

114121010.baseEffect_:
Storm.
Last Words: Deal 2 damage to the enemy leader.

114121010.evoFlair_: While fighting an intruder, my hand slipped... And just like that, a new technique was born! I will call it "spear-throwing!" Elven spear-fighting will never be the same! —Elven Pikeman

126121020.evoFlair_:

111131020.evoFlair_: I'll break you. I'll burn your skin, melt your bones, and rot your insides. But don't worry—it won't kill you. I want to keep you around to play for a long, long time...

119141010.evoFlair_: I'm hunting a certain quarry; a monster with power that can rival even my own. My eyes have landed on you, but tell me—what is it you see when you look at me?

"The forest's, like, really bouncing back."
The once-blighted verdure grows, reaching for the sun.

Fanfare: If an allied Naterran Great Tree is in play, gain the ability to evolve for 0 evolution points.
714141010.baseFlair_:
"It's like... This place is home or whatever, so."
Forever aloof, forever chill...
"That's why I fight. You gotta protect your home, yeah?"
The Stoneclaw looks forward, prepared to do what must be done.
714141010.evoEffect_: Evolve: Put a Send 'Em Packing into your hand.
714141010.evoFlair_:
"Lol. You pissed off the wrong girl, bro."
Claws as hard as granite, strike as strong as boulders...
"Say hi to the birds for me. Toodles."
The Stoneclaw metes out her own brand of justice, sending her foes packing.

118141020.baseEffect_:
Ward.
During your turn, whenever an allied amulet comes into play, recover 1 play point.
During your turn, whenever an allied amulet leaves play, randomly summon a Dutiful Steed, Bullet Bike, or Arcane Personnel Carrier. Each of these amulets can be summoned only once per turn with this effect. (Transformation doesn't count as leaving play.)
118141020.baseFlair_:
"We're good, hardworkin' folk now." "I was a mean varmint." "That danged cactus, hunter, and them giants..." "Got me real good." "You're way too strong." "He didn't just capture me that day; he captured my heart."
—Hardworking Citizens of Jessop State
118141020.evoFlair_:
I ain't here to tie you down, brother. This lasso here ain't a weapon; it's a handshake that binds us together. So take my hand and let's get to work. We'll turn this wasteland of dust and gravel into our new home.
—Loxis K. Jessop

118141030.baseEffect_:
Crystallize (1): Countdown (3)
Fanfare: Destroy an enemy follower with 2 defense or less.
Last Words: Put a Levon, Scentbound Sword into your hand.
----------
Fanfare: Destroy an enemy follower. Then, if at least 4 enemy followers have been destroyed this match by an allied Levon, Scentbound Sword's Fanfare effect, deal 5 damage to the enemy leader.
118141030.baseFlair_: Though flowers scatter, their scent remains. That lingering fragrance is a precious, soothing balm to me. I long to greet the blooms again next season, and that is why I cannot fall!
118141030.evoFlair_: A flower's beauty lies in its transience. The more we mourn their fading, the more pathos we feel. I must cull the weeds before the next season comes. I wonder what scent you'll leave behind as you're severed from your stem!

128141020.baseEffect_:
During your turn, whenever an allied Fairy comes into play, recover 1 play point.
Whenever you play a card, if it's the third card you've played this turn, destroy all allied Fairies, summon a Fairy Beast, and activate its Fanfare. If it's the sixth card, destroy all allied Fairies, summon a Strix of the Wayward Wood, and activate its Fanfare. If it's the ninth card, destroy all allied Fairies and summon a Sky Devouring Horror.
128141020.baseFlair_: My family attends to several mythical creatures! I want to learn everything I can about them and our home, which has a long history with Vitherwood. —Vitherwood School of Agriculture, Term 400 Scholarship Applicant
128141020.evoFlair_:
Vitherwood has always been part of my life! I grew up in a fairy tree-fortress on the edge of the Wonderweald, which you may know as the hometown of the Father of Farmland—and Resplendent Roast Chicken!
—Vitherwood Student Spotlight

122114010.baseEffect_:
Draw 4 cards.
Deal 4 damage to a random enemy follower. Do this X times. X equals the number of cards drawn with this effect that were destroyed instead of being added to your hand.
122114010.baseFlair_: What will the fairy dust be used for? Nothing good, but the humans get their profits and the fairies get their fun.

101134010.baseEffect_: Deal 1 damage to a random enemy follower. Do this X times. X equals the number of other cards in your hand.
101134010.baseFlair_: Go back to the ground from whence you came, evildoers.

101134030.baseEffect_: Return all followers to the players' hands.

128134010.baseEffect_:
Return an allied follower or amulet to your hand.

128134010.baseFlair_: His howled command stirs the heart before reason or instinct can catch up.

101132010.baseEffect_: Can evolve an allied Fairy each turn for 0 evolution points.
101132010.baseFlair_: This is where our dazzling queen reigns. Where radiantly colored wings abound. Where eternal secrets sleep.

100111070.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Deal 1 damage to a random enemy follower. Do this 2 times.
100111070.baseFlair_: I won't let you get away! You're going to regret the mess you made in our home! You really think you can outrun these arrows? Ha!
100111070.evoFlair_: Prepare yourselves! Turn your back and your fate is sealed! Don't worry though. I won't let you suffer.

114111020.baseEffect_:
Rush.
Fanfare: Gain +1/+1 for each Fairy in your hand.
114111020.baseFlair_:
If fairies are the eyes of the forest, elves are its arms. Fairies discover intruders and confound them until elves arrive to put an end to the incursion.
—Step into the Forest, Chapter 2
114111020.evoEffect_: (Same as the unevolved form, excluding Fanfare.)
114111020.evoFlair_:
You might expect there to be friction between the carefree fairies and duty-bound elves—and you would be correct. This does not, however, impede their ability to collaborate.
—Step into the Forest, Chapter 3

120111030.baseEffect_:
Ward.
Fanfare: Destroy an enemy follower.
120111030.baseFlair_: The best place to hide a tree is in the forest. That's because, though the forest itself cannot hide, it is likely to crush those who seek it.
120111030.evoEffect_: (Same as the unevolved form, excluding Fanfare.)
120111030.evoFlair_: There are many who refuse to see the forest for the trees. That's because the forest looks down on all, but none dare to meet its gaze.

122111020.baseEffect_:
Rush.
Fanfare: Gain +X/+X. X equals the number of other cards in your hand.
Enhance (8): Gain Storm.
122111020.baseFlair_: You'd better surrender now. If you don't release my friend, I'll release the tempest!
122111020.evoEffect_: (Same as the unevolved form, excluding Fanfare.)
122111020.evoFlair_: The winds won't stop no matter how hard you beg. Words stop reaching me once I get like this—especially the words of filthy vermin who see my friend as nothing more than profit!

100121010.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Give +1/+1 to all allied followers if at least 2 other cards were played this turn.
100121010.baseFlair_: Well, of course, it began as just a teeny little chemical to help my dear plants grow. But the more I tinkered and toyed and experimented... Well, let's just say that now my dear plants grow however I want them to!
100121010.evoFlair_: With this gift for plants, I've got a duty to protect the forest dwellers! Now then, everyone, come drink this secret medicine! One drop and you'll be bursting with power!

101121060.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Evolve if at least 2 other cards were played this turn.
101121060.baseFlair_: The great, wise tree that serves as lord of the forest. It supports the trunks that creak beneath the weight of snow and encourages the shrubs that freeze in the frost.
101121060.evoFlair_: Once cruel winter passes, the buds of the new spring await. The king of the fairies' forest visits each spot anew, basking in the vigor of the new season.

101121070.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Restore X defense to your leader. X equals the number of other cards in your hand.
101121070.baseFlair_: A kindly beast dispatched by the Beast King to watch over the fairies. Its wings are said to heal the injured forest.
101121070.evoFlair_: Infused with the fairies' prayers of gratitude, the wings of the guardian glimmer brightly. It draws power from respect and trust, and with that strength it strikes down evil.

102121030.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Gain +1/+1 for each other card in your hand.
102121030.baseFlair_: Once, long ago, the world was nothing but nature. But then the defilers came, armed with their infernal knowledge, and nature wilted before them.
102121030.evoFlair_: From the heart of the forest, the Master of the Canopies bellows his rage. He goes forth to annihilate the defilers, and to restore the world to its former pristine state.

105121030.baseEffect_:
Ward.
Fanfare: Give all other allied followers +1/+1 if you have at least 3 other Neutral cards in your hand.
105121030.baseFlair_: A spirit of the great tree that watches over the forest. Its life force is bound to the woods through the earth's meridians. Animals love the tree, and forest guardians hold it dear.
105121030.evoEffect_: (Same as the unevolved form, excluding Fanfare.)
105121030.evoFlair_: Forest guardians made offerings in appreciation of the woodlands' bounty. They helped the tree's soothing flowers to bloom and brought together the people in peace.

106121030.baseEffect_: Clash: Deal 1 damage to all enemy followers.
106121030.baseFlair_: It's a demon that lives in the depths of a gloomy forest. It uses its blade to shake the earth, removing any who would trespass in its territory.
106121030.evoFlair_: It's a demon that lives in the depths of a dying forest. Visit its home out of curiosity and you may find yourself cut down.

116121020.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Deal 3 damage to a random enemy follower and then 3 damage to the enemy leader.
116121020.baseFlair_:
I'm the strongest in the forest—every lad and lass depends on me! No matter yer problem, my trusty hatchets'll solve it!
"What's that, boy? A fallen tree! I'm on my way!"
116121020.evoFlair_:
I'm the elf everyone loves—and I like it that way! No matter yer problem, my trusty hatchets are always here to help!
"The weather might ruin your picnic? Not on my watch! I'm on my way!"

124121020.baseEffect_:
Accelerate (1): Return an allied follower or amulet to your hand. Put a random Forestcraft follower from your deck into your hand.
----------
Storm.
Strike: Deal 2 damage to all enemy followers.
124121020.baseFlair_:
"You catch sight of any 'em pests scurrying around?" "Cheep!"
"That's our cue, gang! Let's teach 'em what happens to trespassers in these here woods!" "Groar!"
"Time for some carnage up in this foliage!"
124121020.evoFlair_:
The bird is the eyes, the wolf the mount, and the cat the hunter. "Who the hell are these guys?" "S-somebody help!"
Festivity turns to chaos as people are hunted down like animals. "That'll teach you to intrude on our forest!"

717121010.baseEffect_:
Accelerate (1): Return an allied follower or amulet to your hand. Put a random Forestcraft follower from your deck into your hand.
----------
Storm.
Strike: Deal 2 damage to all enemy followers.
717121010.baseFlair_: When I run, everything else disappears from my mind. With each step, the wind's soft whistle fades into the warm, steady beat of my heart.
717121010.evoEffect_:
(Same as the unevolved form.)

(This card will be treated as a Woodland Pest Control.)
717121010.evoFlair_:
"Siiiilence Suzuka! Silence Suzuka takes first!"
Racing takes me to a new world full of wonders I've never seen. I want to push myself further! Reach my goals faster!

102131010.baseEffect_: Whenever another allied follower attacks, give it +1/+0.
102131010.baseFlair_: The woods must be protected. I am both the sword and shield of the king, and it is in his name that I now act.
102131010.evoEffect_:
Evolve: Summon 2 Fairies.
Whenever another allied follower attacks, give it +1/+0.
102131010.evoFlair_: Hear me, dryads, for you are the swords and shields of our king as well. May your shimmering wings light the path to victory!

102131020.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Select an enemy follower. It can't attack next turn. If that follower has 3 attack or less, return it to the opponent's hand instead.
102131020.baseFlair_: It's nothin' personal. I'm just doin' my job. Now hold still.
102131020.evoFlair_: My arrow's aimed right at you, so you're as good as dead.

103131030.baseEffect_:
Ward.
Fanfare: Deal 2 damage to all enemies if at least 2 other cards were played this turn.
103131030.baseFlair_: A lion-headed god of war, Maahes crushes all invaders who dare to step foot within the sacred realm. With each ruthless swing, the rampaging lion cuts evil in two.
103131030.evoEffect_: (Same as the unevolved form, excluding Fanfare.)
103131030.evoFlair_: The lion god's fearsome attacks against the fiendish army were unceasing. The battle raged throughout the day and into the night as the great lion exterminated his foes, solidifying his legacy.

104131020.baseEffect_:
Ward.
Fanfare: Restore 3 defense to your leader.
Enhance (8): Recover 1 evolution point.
104131020.baseFlair_: The Crystal Palace is our home, the only place we belong. Visitors aren't welcome here, especially ones who would defile our home.
104131020.evoEffect_: (Same as the unevolved form, excluding Fanfare.)
104131020.evoFlair_: You seem to be interested in us, but I have no interest in you. So why not do us both a favor and leave? If you don't, you'll see just how much colder our reception can get.

107131020.baseEffect_:
Rush.
Fanfare: Give all other allied followers +1/+0. Give all other allied followers Rush if at least 2 other cards were played this turn.
107131020.baseFlair_: You're all still so young, so fragile. So please, fall back and leave it to me. I'll take care of this, even if it means getting my hands dirty!
107131020.evoEffect_: (Same as the unevolved form, excluding Fanfare.)
107131020.evoFlair_: Through the root of a single tree, the Dark defiled our forest. It's too late to save it—too late to heal it. That is why I must fight! In the name of the mother forest, and mother nature!

118131010.baseEffect_:
Accelerate (1): Summon a Dutiful Steed.
----------
Fanfare: Summon an Arcane Personnel Carrier and Bullet Bike. Deal X damage to all enemies. X equals the number of allied amulets in play.
118131010.baseFlair_:
Those giants don't frighten ya, huh? Well, they are all gentle as lambs. Grass don't grow so well in these parts, but the giants grow it on their backs and then let the cattle graze.
—Stagecoach Driver, Jessop City
118131010.evoFlair_: New around here, huh? I get why some grown-ups'd be scared. But we kids grew up playin' on the pasture, so we're all right. Then why ain't I workin' on the ranch? I wanted to try somethin' new. The spare change don't hurt, either. —Shoeshine Kid, Jessop City

120131020.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Summon a Swiftgait Okami. If at least 4 other cards were played this turn, evolve the Swiftgait Okami and this follower, then recover 5 play points.
120131020.baseFlair_: There's no one fleeter of foot than the wolves, and no one with a better view of the forest than the birds. When we put our talents together, we of the forest become one body, one mind, one spirit!
120131020.evoFlair_: There's only so much an individual can accomplish on their own, but we can definitely rout our foes if we work together. I'll be the heart that unites the forest, so please, everybody—be my limbs!

128131020.baseEffect_:
Fanfare: Destroy a random enemy follower and then deal X damage to the enemy leader. If at least 10 allied Forestcraft followers have left play this match, destroy 3 instead. X equals 2 times the number of enemy followers destroyed.
Fanfare: Enhance (9) - Summon a Primal Giant.
128131020.baseFlair_:
Always opposed logging. Weighed too much on my conscience. When I see how cramped the trees are now though, I wonder. Please, help me learn. What truly is best for the forest?
—Vitherwood School of Agriculture, Term 220 Applicant
128131020.evoFlair_: After graduation, he returned to the Wonderweald and put his research into practice. He thinned the dense woods, easing their drain of local tree sprits' mana. This pioneer is frequently cited in textbooks, even today! —Vitherwood Alum Spotlight #2

101141010.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Put Fairies into your hand until it is full. (A hand can hold 9 cards.)
101141010.baseFlair_: This is the garden of the fairies, a peaceful place for the pure at heart. You were led here by the twinkling lights, weren't you? Is your conscience clear enough to let you in?
101141010.evoFlair_: Here, don't you see? The glimmer of the moon, the trees—look, even the fairies themselves bless you. Come now, won't you dance with me beneath this radiant moonlight?

105141010.baseEffect_:
Fanfare: If you have at least 5 other cards in your hand, gain +2/+2. If there are at least 3 other neutral cards in your hand, gain the following effects.
-Can't be destroyed by effects.
-Reduce damage from effects to 0.
105141010.baseFlair_: A statuesque princess and a ferocious warrior. One half of this unlikely pair is a beauty; the other is a beast. Drawn together by their beautiful hearts, the two have created a bond that transcends love.
105141010.evoFlair_: These two share a bond of pure love. Though their forms may differ, their hearts and their affections are equally sincere. They feel no shame when proclaiming their love to the world.

106141010.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Deal 1 damage to a random enemy follower. Do this X times. X equals the number of other cards in your hand.
106141010.baseFlair_: My beautiful figure is unrivaled—praise it! No matter how brightly the stars shine, they pale before me.
106141010.evoFlair_: My beauty—my very light—is the greatest glory covering the heavens. Come on, you surface dwellers! Have every word of adulation at your disposal for me!

706141010.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Deal 1 damage to a random enemy follower. Do this X times. X equals the number of other cards in your hand.
706141010.baseFlair_: My beautiful figure is unrivaled—praise it! No matter how brightly the stars shine, they pale before me.
706141010.evoFlair_: My beauty—my very light—is the greatest glory covering the heavens. Come on, you surface dwellers! Have every word of adulation at your disposal for me!

108141010.baseEffect_:
Drain.
Fanfare: Choose - Put a Blessings of Creation or Wrath of Nature into your hand.
108141010.baseFlair_: The first greenery to germinate in the world. Her limitless mercy comforts all creation, and her hidden might makes all nature tremble.
108141010.evoEffect_: (Same as the unevolved form, excluding Fanfare.)
108141010.evoFlair_: The mother of life, the source of providence. Her infinite love spreads across the continent like the greenery. And if the world's path should ever be in err, that love shall turn to wrath and cover the world like greenery.

108141020.baseEffect_:
Ward.
If this follower's attack or defense is increased by an effect during your turn, evolve this follower.
108141020.baseFlair_: The white primate's eyes dart to the right, dart to the left. Young though it is, this forest warrior is intent on defending its verdant cradle.
108141020.evoFlair_: The mantle of reason is cast off and that of animality done on. Cutting down the enemy vanguard—crying out—is the white primate. Its two tremendous fists, imbued with nature's wrath, power it onward.

108141030.baseEffect_:
Rush.
Fanfare: Give your leader the following effect - At the end of your turn, if at least 3 cards were played this turn, deal 2 damage to the enemy leader. (This effect lasts for the rest of the match.)
108141030.baseFlair_:
The one shall alight in a land of great verdancy. Bearing an axe clad in sage cyclones, he will color the land in shades of green. He is the long-awaited vessel of unadorned nature. —
Book of Prophecies, Nature Scrolls
108141030.evoEffect_: (Same as the unevolved form, excluding Fanfare.)
108141030.evoFlair_: The one shall dispel the realm of demons who oppose nature. The one is our hope, the power of the forest. Our future is entrusted there in the axe that he wields. —Book of Prophecies, Nature Scrolls

111141020.baseEffect_: At the end of your turn, if at least 4 cards were played this turn, double all other allied followers' attack and defense, then remove this effect.
111141020.baseFlair_: I once lost myself in these woods and wandered, watering the trees with my tears. But now I have so many friends. That's why I became the forest oracle. Let my dance buoy you up. Then give whoever bothers us a lesson they won't soon forget!
111141020.evoFlair_: I am the kindhearted forest oracle. Even if you trespass against me, I won't take your life. I'll smack you around, make you cry, and let everyone laugh themselves sick at your expense... but I'll let you off with that.

112141010.baseEffect_:
Fanfare: Give another unevolved allied Forestcraft follower the ability to evolve for 0 evolution points.
During your turn, whenever another allied follower evolves, summon 2 Fairy Wisps.
112141010.baseFlair_: Forest folk, can you hear me? On our new queen's honor, the time has come for us to raise our swords once again. We shall bring victory to this forest!
112141010.evoEffect_:
Evolve: Summon 2 Fairies.
During your turn, whenever another allied follower evolves, summon 2 Fairy Wisps.
112141010.evoFlair_:
"Cynthia became a knight just for me!"
—Liza, Queen of the Forest
"She's a bit of a stick-in-the-mud, but her heart's in the right place."
—Marion, Fierce Dragonewt

116141020.baseEffect_:
Fanfare: If any other Machina cards were played this turn, gain Storm.
Strike: Deal X damage to all enemies. X equals the number of allied Machina followers in play.
116141020.baseFlair_: Spin the helix, and the dead hand of time will spin with it. The forest will know the coming changes, no matter how small or apparent. One more rotation toward progress, guided by my drill. Only I can bore through to tomorrow.
116141020.evoEffect_: (Same as the unevolved form, excluding Fanfare.)
116141020.evoFlair_: The land howls in agony, having been awoken by a fool trying to bore through its crust. Seas rise up, gales tear through trees, volcanoes send lava rushing onto the battlefield. The struggle between the earth and the drill has begun.

117141020.baseEffect_:
Fusion: Forestcraft followers that originally cost 2 play points or more
Whenever 2 or more cards are fused to this card at once, gain +2/+0 and draw a card.
----------

117141020.baseFlair_:
It's a walking guillotine, for lack of a better name. Nothing is safe from its blades. Not trees, not the earth, and of course, not necks. The condemned have only to wait their turn.
—Waiting for the End, Preface
117141020.evoFlair_:
Watch how the blades dance through the air. The first slash slices in two, and the second dices indiscriminately. Take a seat. Tremble while you still can. The execution is about to begin.
—Waiting for the End, Epilogue

Crystallize (1): Countdown (1)

119141020.baseFlair_: His hooves thunder atop the black canopy. He nocks a star to his bow, a twinkling arrow that pierces through the sky and captivates all who dwell below. Kneel before him, for he can also sweep the dust of all creation clean, leaving the canopy blank once more.
119141020.evoEffect_: (Same as the unevolved form, excluding Fanfare.)
119141020.evoFlair_: Inside him is reason: a desire for an unchanging order and absolute obedience. Those who oppose him are sinners, doomed to be ravaged by his arrows. The time to evade atonement has run out—One arrow will rain down devastation a thousand times over.

120141030.baseEffect_:

120141030.evoFlair_:
The flower towers above other flora and fauna, as though looking down upon them all. There is a constant stench of death in the air, punctuated by the screams of its victims...
—Excerpt from an Explorer's Melted Notebook

Ward.

121141010.baseFlair_: The dreams we once lived for are no more. From now on, the blades of our guild will stand courageously for true justice and usher in a peaceful new dawn. Each of us is a drop of shimmering dew and together we are the canals—the lifeblood that courses throughout Isunia.
121141010.evoEffect_:
Ward.
Evolve: Restore 2 defense to your leader. Recover 2 play points.

121141010.evoFlair_: The memory of her beautiful eyes and his regret still drown him. The proud beastfolk takes up the mantle of the marshal nonetheless, striving to become the healing sun that warms Isunia. He vows to never again spill tears, for they are hers to carry on the journey beyond.

126141010.baseEffect_:

I like tending to flowers. I like pretty things. I was never any good at running or physical activities... I thought that I might never fit in if I didn't change something about myself...
—Itsuki Mitsutagawa

Evolve: Return all other followers to the players' hands.

Shadowverse taught me that I didn't have to change. I can walk the path of my own choosing; that's my strength! Waltz with fangs of purest white! Dance, Cosmos Fang!
—Itsuki Mitsutagawa

Ward.

103111060.evoFlair_: It's not like I haven't learned a thing or two over the centuries. Don't be thinking it'll be easy to trespass in these woods!

Storm.

I got eyes on the quarry! Geez, it's fast! But a pup like that is no match for me!
—Hunter's Journal Entry
117111030.evoFlair_:
I chased after it in the darkness. Then it started... growing. Man, I screwed up bad. And now I might have to pay the price...
—Hunted's Journal Entry

101121110.baseEffect_: Fanfare: All enemy followers in play can't attack next turn if at least 2 other cards were played this turn.

101121110.evoFlair_: So massive is the beast that all one can do is tremble and quake in fear. To defy it would be to face the incredible wrath of nature itself.

102121040.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Put 2 Fairies into your hand and change their costs to 0.
102121040.baseFlair_: We go forth now to destroy those who would see our forest burn! Dwellers of the forest, lend me your strength!
102121040.evoFlair_: No matter how infertile the soil, hope is a plant that always finds a way to sprout! Today, dwellers of the forest, we fight for hope!

104121040.baseEffect_: Clash: Deal 2 damage to the enemy leader.
104121040.baseFlair_: Devils! Ya got some brass to step foot in the city of dwarves. I'll dice up every last one of ya!
104121040.evoFlair_: This beard's m'pride and joy! And I swear on every strand that none of ya devils will get away. Now here's what a dwarf can do!

110131010.baseEffect_:
Whenever an allied follower is destroyed, subtract 1 from the cost of this card.
----------
Ward.
110131010.baseFlair_: So many sacrifices have been made. So many tears shed. I can't shoulder it all, but I can make sure it ends here. Yes—I swear it!
110131010.evoFlair_:
"Coordination will be key in this operation. Understood?"
"Don't be stupid, Bayle. I can handle this alone."
"I... I see. Ugh, I feel sick..."
—Bayle and Sarissa

112131010.baseEffect_:
Rush.
Follower Strike: Reduce damage to this follower to 0 until the end of the turn and deal X damage to the enemy leader. X equals the attack of this follower minus the defense of the enemy follower (no damage is dealt if X is less than 0).
112131010.baseFlair_: It's almost like the heavy weight of metal is a problem of the past. We see this most with the warriors of the forest who have developed weapons for the practicalities of warfare. —Researcher's Report, Part 3
112131010.evoFlair_: You should leave the forest as quick as you can. The inhabitants are using their hunting weapons for battle. And if they've managed to create a powerful weapon for a skilled warrior, well, let's just say you wouldn't want to cross paths with them. —Forest Rumors, Part 3

117131020.baseEffect_:
Accelerate (1): Deal 5 damage to an enemy follower.
(Can only Accelerate if an allied follower has evolved this turn.)
----------
Fanfare: Deal 5 damage to an enemy follower. Then, if the selected follower had 5 defense or less before damage was dealt, evolve this follower.
117131020.baseFlair_: Ungh... Ungh, ungggh! Oh, excuse me. I was experiencing a bout of cuddle withdrawal. I guess this new look of mine isn't doing me any favors either...
117131020.evoEffect_: Once on each of the opponent's turns, when the opponent plays a follower, deal 10 damage to it.
117131020.evoFlair_: I don't mind if the animals drive me batty. But as for intruders, I must ask them to leave. Then I can turn my undivided attention back to the cuddles!

119131010.baseEffect_:
Accelerate (1): Return an allied follower or amulet to your hand. Deal 3 damage to a random enemy follower.
----------
Fanfare: Give your leader the following effect - Once on each of your turns, when you play a card, recover 2 play points and add 2 to the number of cards played this turn. (This effect is not stackable and lasts for the rest of the match.)
119131010.baseFlair_: "Once upon a time, a princess was abducted by a foul monster and taken into the deepest and darkest of forests. A young hero ventured forth to bring her home." "And so the hero and the princess lived happily ever after." —The Forest of Eternal Happiness, Chapters 1 & 4
119131010.evoFlair_: "The forest was a conglomeration of lives that had entwined to become the colossus—and the princess was now a part of it." "The hero sighed, resigned to his fate. The princess held out a beckoning hand, and he took it." —The Forest of Eternal Happiness, Chapters 2 & 3

127131020.baseEffect_:
Crystallize (1): Countdown (1)
Whenever this card is returned to your hand, draw a card.
Last Words: Draw a card.
----------
Ward.
Fanfare: Summon a Warden of Balms.
Can't be targeted by enemy effects.
Last Words: Deal 3 damage to the enemy leader.
127131020.baseFlair_:
Eager to fathom the world below, I became a lowly insect. I dwelt within a great tree, partaking of its blessings. The cycle of generations, however, was unceremoniously shattered... by an abhorrent act of patricide.
—Transmigration of Redolence, Part 1
127131020.evoEffect_: (Same as the unevolved form, excluding Fanfare.)
127131020.evoFlair_:
For the sake of her son, the mother cut down the ancestral tree. Remorseful, she unleashed a deadly incense to exterminate the tree's inhabitants. Later, when her son pleaded to hear her motives, she fell utterly silent.
—Transmigration of Redolence, Part 2

104141010.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Restore X defense to your leader. X equals the number of shadows you have. Then change your number of shadows to 0.
104141010.baseFlair_: Hear me, you who perished while nobly defending our forest. Your names will live on. Blessings for the brave!
104141010.evoFlair_: The fate of life is to cycle, and your lives are no exception. I won't mourn our parting, for I know that we'll meet again in time.

113141010.baseEffect_:
Storm.
Fanfare: Return 2 other allied cards to your hand. Summon X Okami. X equals the number of cards returned.
Whenever an allied Okami comes into play, give it Rush.
113141010.baseFlair_: Where he treads, the earth blooms; where he bays, there is life. This is how the forest began. He—the steward of the primal forest—is nothing less than the cycle of life and rebirth. —Elder Lore, "Forest Beginnings"
113141010.evoEffect_: (Same as the unevolved form, excluding Fanfare.)
113141010.evoFlair_: The earth in time withered again, and his life in time ended. It was a new genesis for all. Even should the earth wilt, life and rebirth cycle for all eternity. —Elder Lore, "Forest Endings"

714141020.baseEffect_:
Storm.

900141040.baseEffect_:
Invocation: At the start of your turn, if you've played at least 6 Greenwood Guardians this match, invoke this card.
----------
Storm.
900141040.baseFlair_: Life is a famished beast ravening for nourishment. That is why the law exists. The forest law supports life, like the sturdy trunk of a tree. You must understand that freedom is but a sweet poison.
900141040.evoFlair_: The law is as ivy, as thorns. It is troublesome to be bound by, painful to be stuck by. But if you are to live in this forest, it cannot be avoided. You must understand that freedom is but a sweet poison.

125141030.baseEffect_:
Accelerate (1): Put a Carbuncle's Sparkle into your hand.
(Can only Accelerate if an allied follower has evolved this turn.)
----------
Fanfare: Put a Carbuncle's Sparkle into your hand. Subtract 1 from the cost of all Forestcraft cards in your hand and deck.
125141030.baseFlair_:
Native generally to woodlands, the carbuncle's jewel shines in perpetuity. Though time returns flora and fauna to the earth, it doesn't dim the jewel's luster. Its presence is the symbol of the forest's vitality and abundance.
—Compendium of Beasts, On Carbuncles
125141030.evoFlair_:
Native mainly to the forests, the jewel on its forehead repels beasts, hunters, and other threats. Its presence is the symbol of the forest's pure verdancy, tranquility, and peace.
—Compendium of Beasts, On Carbuncles

101121100.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Deal X damage to an enemy follower. X equals the number of other cards in your hand.
101121100.baseFlair_: A young giant was separated from his herd and raised in the grace of the great trees until one day he found he'd become the forest's watchman. He now carries a staff cut from his mother tree and pulverizes invaders with a single blow.
101121100.evoFlair_: Routed by the giant, the invaders roused a band of soldiers to counterattack. But the giant, a friend of the forest, was aided by enough animals to overcome the militia. With his trusted friends, the giant turned back the trespassers once more.

109121030.baseEffect_:
Ambush.
Strike: Give -1/-0 to all enemy followers if Ambush is active for this follower.
109121030.baseFlair_: It was the soft crunch of a bear's footsteps. The hunter's practiced ears recognized it as he retreated into the shadows. A bear is to be left alone. That is, if it was a bear, of course.
109121030.evoFlair_: It certainly was the crunch of a bear's footsteps. However, its eyes gleam with the shrewdness of a bird of prey. Whether in the dead of night or light of day, those eyes astutely take their next target.

101131040.baseEffect_:
Ward.
Fanfare: Give all other allied followers the following effect - Can't be targeted by enemy effects.
101131040.baseFlair_: An ancient dragon who has stood guard over the forest since time immemorial. It has bestowed its love on the fairies so as to protect the harmony of the woods.
101131040.evoEffect_: (Same as the unevolved form, excluding Fanfare.)
101131040.evoFlair_: The old dragon knows every twig and root of the forest, and it speaks the wisdom of the woods themselves. The fairies gather in the moonlight to hear its words.

101141030.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Transform each Fairy in your hand into a Thorn Burst.
101141030.baseFlair_: See the roses blooming? The deep red petals beckon to you. Such an intoxicating color. Can the pulsing crimson within you resist? Even knowing the thorns will wound you, you still come. How sad you are.
101141030.evoFlair_: See us grow so beautifully, proud, and unhindered? We only want to be beautiful—and if you would mar us, expect no mercy. I'll teach you that you have no right to pluck a flower that grows only to be beautiful.

103141010.baseEffect_:
Rush.
Last Words: Randomly put 1 of the highest-cost Forestcraft cards (excluding White Wolf of Eldwood) from your deck into your hand at the start of your next turn. Change its cost to 0.
103141010.baseFlair_: A lupine god referred to as the sage of the forest. This beast provided wisdom to an ancient dragon, which knew only how to rule tyrannically, and conveyed orders to protect the forest.
103141010.evoFlair_: A lupine god who confronts intruders from the outside world. Until the guardian dragon awakens, the wolf will lead the woodland forces against all who would disrupt the forest's harmony.

104141020.baseEffect_: Leader Strike: Deal damage to the enemy leader until their defense drops to 0.
104141020.baseFlair_: It suddenly appeared in the darkest depths of the forest and silently began its inexorable invasion of the surrounding land. The sounds of the trees fracturing and splintering before it were almost like screams.
104141020.evoFlair_: From deep within its own insides, it dragged out a great and terrible spear. With a bellow that shook the trees to their very roots, it proclaimed the end of the forest.

703141010.baseEffect_: Leader Strike: Deal damage to the enemy leader until their defense drops to 0.
703141010.baseFlair_: It suddenly appeared in the darkest depths of the forest and silently began its inexorable invasion of the surrounding land. The sounds of the trees fracturing and splintering before it were almost like screams.
703141010.evoFlair_: From deep within its own insides, it dragged out a great and terrible spear. With a bellow that shook the trees to their very roots, it proclaimed the end of the forest.

111141030.baseEffect_:
Fanfare: Summon 2 Hornet Warriors.
Whenever an allied Hornet Warrior attacks the enemy leader, put a Hornet Sting into your hand.
111141030.baseFlair_:
The hornet queen lounges on her throne, the power of ten thousand drones loosely grasped in her idle hands.
"Ah, I'm so bored. Can't I just dissolve it all?"
With but a twitch of those sticky fingers, she could end the world by sundown.
111141030.evoEffect_: (Same as the unevolved form, excluding Fanfare.)
111141030.evoFlair_:
Sticky with nectar, the hornet queen sprawls over her throne and yawns.
"Ah, so sleepy... Maybe I'll dissolve the world tomorrow."
She sleeps, and the world sees another dawn.

112141030.baseEffect_:
Ambush.
Fanfare: Give your leader the following effect - During your turn, whenever an effect returns 1 or more cards to a player's hand, deal X damage to the enemy leader. X equals 2 times the number of cards that left play. (This effect is not stackable and lasts for the rest of the match.)
112141030.baseFlair_: Contained within the Vajano Marsh is a murky pool, as fetid as it is deep. Below the surface of this abyss is where the mad lord of the forest resides. Those who enter his waters become his playthings, and whether they walk away or drown, it's purely his whim.
112141030.evoEffect_:
Ambush.
Evolve: Return an enemy follower to the opponent's hand.
112141030.evoFlair_: When did his reign begin, and how long will it last? A lord lost forever to isolation, he searches for a companion. If he should ever hear the telltale signs of a plaything escaping beyond his grasp, the resulting howl would rattle the surrounding woodlands.

Rush.

122141030.baseFlair_:
Never underestimate a pro. My pride and resolve are on a different level.
—Shiro Kiriyama
122141030.evoEffect_: (Same as the unevolved form, excluding Fanfare.)
122141030.evoFlair_:
Never underestimate a pro. Even if you get an edge on me, I won't go down without a fight!
—Shiro Kiriyama

127141020.baseEffect_:
During your turn, whenever an allied effect returns 1 or more cards to a player's hand, subtract X from the cost of this card. X equals the number of cards returned.
----------
When this follower leaves play, summon a Wimael, Redolent Enforcer. (Transformation doesn't count as leaving play.)
127141020.baseFlair_: Such insolence and impudence. You must learn respect, for without it, all is chaos. Roots and weeds that do not know their place grow wild in anarchic fervor... Why do you not see, the path you seek to carve out is barren? I, Wimael, will punish this sullied sinner.
127141020.evoFlair_: Let the winds teach you the meaning of respect. Prostrate yourself in penance for your shameful deeds. The aromatic gale will batter away at you, till you are wilted. To erase the odor of the one most foul, a punishment in Redolence seems apt.

119111040.baseEffect_:
Accelerate (1): Return an allied follower or amulet to your hand. Put a Fairy Wisp into your hand.
----------
Storm.
Can attack 2 times per turn.
119111040.baseFlair_: A whisper on the wind tells me of a threat to the forest. Now is the time for us to put all our training to use and defend our home. Follow me to victory! Float like a butterfly, sting like— Hey, where did everybody go?!
119111040.evoFlair_:
"You're flying too fast, I can't keep up!"
"Forget stinging like a bee, try waiting like a snail for once!"
—Fellow Fairies Left Behind

123131020.baseEffect_:
During your turn, whenever an allied follower evolves, subtract 1 from the cost of this card.
----------
Fanfare: Deal 6 damage to all other followers.
At the end of your turn, deal X damage to the enemy leader. X equals the number of followers destroyed this turn.
123131020.baseFlair_: The life of the forest is etched into the ancient mammoth's tusks. Alas, history is older than even the mammoth, and it soon overwhelms the prodigious creature. The weight of history causes its horns and, in turn, its very nature to twist.
123131020.evoEffect_: (Same as the unevolved form, excluding Fanfare.)
123131020.evoFlair_: The mammoth pulverizes the nourishing earth under its feet. The flora and fauna it once lived in harmony with are trampled like enemy hordes. The unbroken circle of life sustaining the forest is now a twisted spiral of destruction.

109141030.baseEffect_:
At the end of your turn, if at least 7 cards were played this turn, gain +7/+7. (This follower must be in your hand for this effect to activate.)
----------
Storm.
109141030.baseFlair_:
The forest is merciful and amiable—its generosity welcomes all forms of life. However, sometimes such kindness takes after foolishness.
—Stolen Verdant, Chapter 3
109141030.evoFlair_:
It is ruthless without mercy—a hateful being despising all forms of life. From the virtuous to the foolish, it devours all.
—Stolen Verdant, Chapter 10

114141030.baseEffect_:
Accelerate (1): Restore 4 defense to your leader.
----------
Ward.
Fanfare: Randomly summon copies of allied Forestcraft followers of different costs (excluding Primal Giant) destroyed during this match until your area is full.
When this follower leaves play, randomly summon copies of allied Forestcraft followers of different costs (excluding Primal Giant) destroyed during this match until your area is full. (Transformation doesn't count as leaving play.)
114141030.baseFlair_:
A flower blooms, wilts, and, given enough time, sprouts anew. Why? Because the earth remembers that flower. So we, too, are born, die, travel through the memories of the earth, and are reborn.
—Oral Traditions of the Forest
114141030.evoEffect_: (Same as the unevolved form, excluding Fanfare.)
114141030.evoFlair_: Scouts and monsters thought to be dead returned as an attacking mob. I remain unaware of the cause or mechanism of their return, a failure in my research. But I am calling off this experiment. That forest ... is too unsettling. —Research notes regarding a certain forest

129141020.baseEffect_:
Accelerate (3): Summon an Oberon.
(Can only Accelerate if you've played at least 30 cards this match.)
----------
Ward.
Fanfare: Evolve this follower.
129141020.baseFlair_: He sits upon his throne, watching over all creation. From an elder tree, a seed floats into his palm. The king watches his children grow, nurtured by a verdant lullaby—a millennium a mere instant in the forest's life.
129141020.evoEffect_:
Storm.
Ward.
Can attack 2 times per turn.
129141020.evoFlair_: He looks upon his children with unbridled delight. Should anyone dare to pluck their small lives, he is ready to mete brutal justice. The forest responds to his righteous anger—the leaves cut like knives, the ground trembles, and his wings are dyed in crimson.

101134020.baseEffect_: Draw a card. Then deal X damage to an enemy. X equals the number of other cards in your hand.
101134020.baseFlair_: Go, my silver; cleanse this green land of evil.

106141020.baseEffect_:
Storm.
Fanfare: Return all other allied followers to your hand. Then, gain +1/+1 for each card in your hand.
Ignore Ward.
106141020.baseFlair_: Those who possess language bring forth something from nothing. Through conversation, negotiation, and resolution, the something is given a name. However those who do not possess language return the something to nothing through howling, mauling, and destroying.
106141020.evoEffect_: (Same as the unevolved form, excluding Fanfare.)
106141020.evoFlair_: Humans are animals that developed through language. They are therefore powerless against those who cannot speak. This creature's roars burst eardrums, and his assault rends flesh. Man can do nothing but fear the coming of nature's purge.

110141010.baseEffect_: Fanfare: Change the enemy leader's maximum defense to 6.
110141010.baseFlair_: I have led a life unwithering—burgeoning, as it were. This way of being is the core of existence. Therefore fear not ruin; one must merely endure eternity. Now, shall we put the world to trial?
110141010.evoFlair_: Pass through the gates of heaven or plunge into the abyss of hell, you will suffer. Your tears will burn your cheeks; your screams will rend your throat. The world will continue, tormented by eternity and cursed with perpetuity. Now, shall we put the world to trial?

128141030.baseEffect_:
Accelerate (1): Return an allied follower or amulet to your hand. Deal 3 damage to a random enemy follower.
----------
Ward.
Fanfare: Gain +X/+Y. X and Y equal the number of other allied cards played this match split randomly.
128141030.baseFlair_: The villagers found the spirit in a shadowed thicket, withered palms together in prayer. "W-water... Soil..." They pruned away the dark canopy and nursed the tree back to health. "Thank you. Thank you. Thank you."
128141030.evoEffect_:
Ward.
Evolve: Deal a pool of Z damage divided between all enemies. Z equals this follower's attack.
128141030.evoFlair_: The villagers found the spirit, basking in light, gnarled palms outstretched. "Water? Soil?" It had grown used to their mercy, to being hand-fed all it desired. "I hunger. I hunger. I HUNGER."

116141010.baseEffect_:
At the end of your turn, if at least 4 cards were played this turn, subtract 4 from the cost of this card.
----------
Fanfare: If at least 4 other cards were played this turn, destroy 4 random enemy followers.
116141010.baseFlair_: Only the forest folk realize the land is asleep. But there's no soul, not even one connected to nature, who can predict what will happen when it awakens.
116141010.evoFlair_:
To reject progress, to refuse change... It's akin to death. I will pierce through anything that aims to obstruct advancement. Whether that seems blasphemous or reckless, I care not—it's all the same to my drill.
—Damian, Drillarm Brawler
